page.title: 06FISHING OFF SEAHAM
page.content: FISHING HAS BEEN THE LIVELIHOOD OF MANY SEAHAM FAMILIES FOR YEARS.SOME PEOPLE OWN LARGE PURPOSE-BUILT FISHING BOATS WHILE OTHERS MAKE DO WITH SMALL COBBLES.THE PEOPLE WHO OWN THE COBBLES USUALLY ONLY FISH FOR ENJOYMENT AND THE CHANCE TO EARN A LITTLE EXTRA MONEY.BECAUSE THE FISHING DOCK HAS NO GATES,THEN THE MEN MUST DEPART AND RETURN ON THE TIDES.THE LARGER BOATS CARRY NETS AND THEY RETURN WITH FISH SUCH AS COD,HADDOCK,HERRING,WHITING , SOLE AND MACKEREL.SOME OF THE SMALLER BOATS DROP WHEIGHTED POTS IN WHICH THEY CATCH CRABS AND LOBSTERS.SALMON IS ONLY ALLOWED TO BE FISHED AT CERTAIN TIMES OF THE YEAR.THE LARGER CATCHES ARE TAKEN TO MARKET AT EITHER SUNDERLAND OR HARTLEPOOL WHILE THE SMALLER CATCHES ARE OFTEN SOLD AT THE TOP OF THE DOCKS BESIDE BARCLAY'S BANK.
